Identifying Characteristics: Olive to gray, shading into a light yellow green on lower flank
Dark vertical markings may be present
Posterior end of the upper jaw extends no farther than posterior edge the orbit of the eye
Biology: Spawn May or early June over gravel or rocky bottom
Size: Up to 8 lbs, but few exceed 4 pounds and 18-20 inches in length
Range: Native Range: Great Lakes, St. Lawrence, and Mississippi drainages
Introduced Range: throughout United States, southern Canada, areas of Europe and Africa
